title: Understanding Data Types
text: Consider the nature of structured and unstructured data. Structured data is organized in a defined manner, often in tables with rows and columns, making it easier to analyze using traditional data tools. Unstructured data, on the other hand, lacks this organization. Think about how this impacts the difficulty of analysis.

title: Examples of Data Types
text: Think about examples of structured data, like spreadsheets or databases, and unstructured data, like emails or social media posts. How does the organization of these data types affect the ease of analysis?

title: Tools for Data Analysis
text: Consider the tools available for analyzing structured data, such as SQL databases, and compare them to the tools needed for unstructured data, like natural language processing or machine learning algorithms. Which type of data requires more complex tools?

title: Analyzing the Complexity
text: Based on the organization and tools required for analysis, determine whether unstructured data is more or less difficult to analyze than structured data.
